hint.text: If the base on both sides of the equation are equal, the exponents can be evaluated with each other.

solution.text:
\(\frac {k^{3x-1}}{k^{2}} = k^3\)
\(k^{3x-1} \times {k^{-2}} = k^3\)
\(k^{3x-3} = k^3\)
As the base on both sides are equal, we can equate the exponents.
\(3x-3 = 3\)
\(x= 6/3\)
\(x=2\)

content.text: If \(\frac {k^{3x-1}}{k^2} = k^3\) find the value of \(x\)
